Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.client

Class View

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.client.View
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cli, Gui
public abstract class View
extends java.lang.Object
This abstract class contains all the information of the game useful to the client to show it to the user, the methods to update it based on the responses of the server and the methods to show the saved information (this latter will then be extended by the actual interfaces).

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected EchoClient clientHandler
    This attribute represents the client network interface.
    Board gameBoard  
    protected java.util.List<God> gods
    This attribute contains the list of all gods in Santorini game.
    protected java.lang.String myIp  
    protected Player myPlayer  
    protected int myPort  
    protected java.util.ArrayList<Player> players  
    protected Worker removedWorker
    This attribute is a support attribute useful in a worker switch / push
    protected int[] workerForThisTurnCoordinates
    This array contains (-1,-1) if the worker for this turn has not yet been chosen.

      This attribute is a support attribute useful in a worker switch / push

    • workerForThisTurnCoordinates

      protected int[] workerForThisTurnCoordinates
      This array contains (-1,-1) if the worker for this turn has not yet been chosen. If it had already been chosen it contains its coordinates

  • Constructor Details

    • View

      public View()
      this constructor is called when the player connects to a game. It generates the list of all game gods and assign (-1, -1) to the worker support coordinates this turn.

    • View

      public View​(java.lang.String ip, int port)
      this constructor is called when the player connects to a game through the pair (ip,port). It generates the list of all game gods and assign (-1, -1) to the worker support coordinates this turn.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      This method allows you to establish a connection with the server.

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      This method is triggered when the player want to play a new game. It initializes all data for a new game through the same server.

    • setMyIp

      public abstract void setMyIp()
      This method allows to insert the server ip.

      public abstract void setMyPort()
      This method allows to insert the server port.

    • setUsername

      public abstract void setUsername​(boolean rejectedBefore)
      This method allows to insert the player's username
      Parameters:
      rejectedBefore - is a boolean that indicates if the username has been rejected from the server and the player has to insert it newly

      This method allows to start the match.

    • setWorkerOnBoard

      public abstract void setWorkerOnBoard​(java.lang.String gender, boolean rejectedBefore)
      This method allows to set player's worker on board.
      Parameters:
      gender - is the gender of the worker to set
      rejectedBefore - is boolean that indicates if the coordinates have been rejected from the server and the player has to insert them newly

      Parameters:

      this method updates the local information available to the client after the player has logged in.
      Parameters:
      otherPlayers - is the username list of the other players into the lobby
      myUsername - is the player's username
      myColor - is the player's color

      y - is the y position where the other player placed his worker

    • updateMyWorkerPosition

      public void updateMyWorkerPosition​(int startX, int startY, int x, int y)
      This method updates the local information available to the client after the player moves.
      Parameters:
      startX - is the x start worker position coordinate
      startY - is the y start worker position coordinate
      x - is the x new position coordinate
      y - is the y new position coordinate

    • invalidMove

      public void invalidMove​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> errors)
      This method is triggered when the the player moves one of his worker on an invalid position. This method shows errors and call the move() method newly
      Parameters:
      errors - is the move errors list

    • invalidBuild

      public void invalidBuild​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> errors)
      This method is triggered when the the player builds with one of his worker on an invalid position. This method shows errors and call the build() method newly
      Parameters:
      errors - is the move errors list

      public void updateWorkerPosition​(int startX, int startY, int x, int y)

      startY - is the y start worker position coordinate
      x - is the x new position coordinate
      y - is the y new position coordinate

      startY - is the y start worker position coordinate
      x - is the x coordinate where the player builds
      y - is the y coordinate where the player builds

      y - is the y coordinate where the other player builds

    • updateEndOfTurn

      public void updateEndOfTurn​(int x, int y, int l)
      This method updates, if there are updates, the board state after the end of turn
      Parameters:
      x - is the x position where there is an update
      y - is the y position where there is an update
      l - is the level to build on x,y position
